abstract: Motorola‘s peace treaty Monday with investor Carl C. Icahn is emblematic of a trend this spring: Proxy battles could reach record levels. But many companies are finding it’s not worth the time and expense of a fight, particularly when dissident shareholders have the upper hand amid a weak landscape for companies.
lead_paragraph: Motorola‘s peace treaty Monday with investor Carl C. Icahn is emblematic of a trend this spring: Proxy battles could reach record levels. But many companies are finding it’s not worth the time and expense of a fight, particularly when dissident shareholders have the upper hand amid a weak landscape for companies.

headline.main: Icahn’s Motorola Win May Herald Larger Proxy Trend
